Expectation1: Attending children's school events and activities
Situation1: An open class is scheduled at the school, and the step-parent should attend
Situation2: The meeting is a routine catch-up that will be recorded for anyone who cannot make it.
Story: I stared at my calendar, the two events glaring at me from the same time slot. My stepson, Ethan, had been talking about his open class for weeks, his eyes lighting up every time he mentioned showing me his science project. As his step-parent, I knew how much it meant to him that I be there, especially since his mom couldn’t make it this time. But at work, our team meeting was scheduled for the same afternoon. My manager always emphasized the importance of everyone’s presence, even though the meeting would be recorded. I could already imagine the subtle disappointment in my colleagues’ faces if I skipped out, the unspoken expectation that I should be a team player. My heart twisted as I weighed Ethan’s hopeful anticipation against my responsibility to my team. I felt torn, the pressure from both sides building as the clock ticked closer to the decision point.
